short_description: Explore the largest country in Africa, Algeria, with its diverse landscapes from the Mediterranean coast to the vast Sahara Desert. Discover ancient Roman ruins, vibrant markets, stunning mountain ranges, and rich Berber and Arab cultural heritage.

health.tap_water_safety: Generally safe in major cities, bottled water recommended
alcohol_info: Alcohol consumption is legal but restricted due to Islamic cultural norms
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed hotels and some restaurants, but availability is limited
Public consumption of alcohol is generally discouraged

tipping.hotels: Small tips for porters and housekeeping are appreciated
tipping.guides: 10% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10% tip is customary for good service, though not always expected
tipping.taxis: Rounding up the fare is common

weather.title: Algeria has a Mediterranean climate along the northern coast with hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. The interior and southern regions have an arid desert climate with extreme temperature variations.

when_to_visit.title: Spring & Autumn
when_to_visit.time_period: March to May, September to November
when_to_visit.short_description: Mild and pleasant temperatures along the coast, perfect for exploring cities like Algiers, Oran, and Constantine. Ideal weather for visiting Roman ruins and historical sites

when_to_visit.title: Summer
when_to_visit.short_description: Hot along the coast, extremely hot in the desert. Good time for coastal activities, but desert travel requires careful planning. Early morning and evening are best for sightseeing

when_to_visit.title: Desert Exploration
when_to_visit.short_description: Cooler temperatures make this the best time for Sahara Desert adventures. Days are warm but nights can be cold. Perfect for camel treks and desert camping

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Algeria is during the spring (March to May) and autumn (September to November) months when the weather along the Mediterranean coast is mild and pleasant, making it ideal for exploring cities, historical sites, and coastal areas
